name: Troubleshooting Guide
format:
Monitoring Dashboard Troubleshooting Guide

ðŸš¨ No Equipment Showing / Blank Dashboard
  1. Check deployment mode: Set to Testing for demo data
  2. Enable simulation in Debug Control Panel
  3. Click Refresh Equipment Data button
  4. Verify debug output in Node-RED sidebar
  5. Check browser console for JavaScript errors
âš ï¸ Data Not Updating / Stale Values
  1. Enable "Data Flow" debug node to see data updates
  2. Check update timer is running (2-second interval)
  3. Verify monitoring is enabled in debug settings
  4. Look for error messages in debug sidebar
  5. Try changing deployment mode and refreshing
âš¡ Connection Issues (MQTT/Modbus/OPC)
  1. Start with Testing mode (simulation only)
  2. Check external service status (MQTT broker, Modbus devices)
  3. Enable detailed logging in debug options
  4. Look for connection errors in debug output
  5. Verify network connectivity to external systems
ðŸ”§ Debug Steps for Data Flow Issues
  1. Enable Debug Nodes:
    Right-click â†’ Enable: "Equipment Loaded", "Data Flow", "Alarm Events"
  2. Check Equipment Count: Should show 4 in testing mode
  3. Monitor Data Generation: Look for parameter updates every 2 seconds
  4. Verify Table Updates: Equipment status table should refresh automatically
âœ… Working Correctly - What You Should See
  • Equipment Count: Shows "4 (Simulated)" in testing mode
  • Parameter Values: Updating every 2 seconds with realistic data
  • Status Table: 4 rows with color-coded status and alarm indicators
  • Occasional Alarms: Red toast notifications for simulated alarms
  • Debug Output: Regular data flow messages in sidebar
ðŸ” Advanced Debugging
  1. Check Global Context:
    global.get('registeredEquipment') // Should return array of equipment
  2. Check Flow Context:
    flow.get('equipmentData') // Should contain real-time data
  3. Monitor Statistics: Use debug control panel to track message counts
  4. Test Mode Changes: Switch between testing/development/production
ðŸ“‹ Quick Fixes
  • Refresh Page: Sometimes UI needs refresh after Node-RED changes
  • Clear Browser Cache: Old dashboard files may be cached
  • Restart Node-RED: If debug settings aren't taking effect
  • Check Console: Browser F12 â†’ Console for JavaScript errors

name: Control Simulation
Dashboard Layout Fix Info
info:
This flow fixes the Node-RED dashboard layout issues:

1. **Tab Order**: Properly orders all dashboard tabs
   - Equipment Registration (1)
   - Monitoring Dashboard (2)
   - Event Dashboard (3)
   - MQTT Analysis (4)
   - Manual Events (5)
   - Phidget Discovery (6)
   - Valve Control (7)

2. **Group Widths**: Sets consistent widths
   - Full width (12 units) for main content areas
   - Half width (6 units) for side-by-side status displays
   - Proper collapse settings for optional sections

3. **Dashboard Settings**: 
   - Configures base theme and site settings
   - Sets proper grid dimensions
   - Enables swipe and menu options

To apply the fix:
1. Deploy this flow
2. Refresh your browser
3. Navigate to the dashboard UI

The layout should now be properly sized without extra long windows.
